product_name: Bare Repair Common Bermudagrass | Lawn Patch Kit | 3-in-1 Repair
description:
Fast repair for bermudagrass bare spots

Fix patchy areas in your bermudagrass lawn with our complete repair solution.

Bare Repair combines premium common bermudagrass seed, slow-release nitrogen, and moisture-retaining mulch to quickly restore thin spots in heat-loving lawns. This all-in-one formula promotes fast germination and establishment of new grass while stimulating your existing bermudagrass. Perfect for hot, sunny areas, this patch repair creates durable, traffic-resistant turf that helps prevent future bare spots. Not suitable for hybrid bermudagrass varieties.

At Sunday, we create lawn solutions that work with nature—so you can enjoy your yard and spend less time maintaining it.

sections.instructions:
For best results, plant in late spring to mid-summer when temperatures are 70-90°F. Requires full sun exposure.
Remove plant debris and break up exposed soil in bare areas for good seed-to-soil contact.
Spread at the recommended rate: 1 cup per 1 sq. ft. for bare areas or 1 pound per 15 sq. ft. for thinning areas.
Water seeded areas 1-2 times daily in early morning and evening until grass reaches about 2" tall. Limit foot traffic on newly patched areas until grass is established.
sections.faq:
Helpful Tips from Lawn Advisors:
What’s the seed rate for Bermuda Time bermudagrass seed?
For maintenance seeding or overseeding: 1 lbs./1000 sq. ft.
For heavy repair, weedy lawns, and new lawns: 1 lbs./1000 sq. ft.
How long does bermudagrass seed take to grow?
Expect germination between 7-21 days with proper moisture and warm temperatures.
When to plant bermudagrass seed?
The optimal time to seed is late spring to mid-summer, when temperatures consistently range between 70 to 90 degrees Fahrenheit.
Can I use this seed on hybrid bermudagrass varieties?
No. Bare Repair Bermudagrass is only for use on common bermudagrass lawns. Hybrid varieties like Tifway 419 and Celebration cannot be seeded – they must be repaired with the same hybrid variety using sod or plugs..
Should I apply Sunday fertilizer before or after using Bare Repair?
Either order works fine—it won't damage the seed. Having nutrients available can enhance growth, but the included fertilizer provides initial nutrition for the new grass.
Are there any US states where this is not approved for use?
This product is only approved for use in southern states, including: AL, AR, AZ, CA, DC, DE, FL, GA, HI, KS, KY, LA, MD, MO, MS, NC, NM, NV, OK, SC, TN, TX, VA, WV
